item.name: use
item.head: Use a profile.
item.body: Syntax: use PROFILE_NAME [directory] Example: use fast_scan Example: use fast_scan /tmp/

item.name: save_as
item.head: Save the current configuration to a profile.
item.body:
Syntax: save_as PROFILE_NAME Example: save_as fast_scan Example: save_as fast_scan self-contained
Please note that the save_as command will overwrite existing profiles with the same name.
When the "self-contained" flag is set the profile will bundle all files referenced by the plugin configurations. This is useful for sharing custom profiles between different workstations. Disabled by default.

item.name: list
item.head: List available plugins.
item.body: Syntax: list PLUGIN_TYPE [all | enabled | disabled] By default all plugins are listed.

item.name: ${TYPE}
item.head: View, configure and enable ${TYPE} plugins

item.name: exploit
item.head: Exploit a vulnerability found by audit plugins.
item.body: Syntax: exploit (PLUGIN_NAME [vulnerability-id] | * [stopOnFirst]) When using "exploit *" you will be running all exploit plugins, ordered by the probability of getting a root shell. When you add the "stopOnFirst" option to the "exploit *" command, you are making w3af stop on the first successbody exploit. Examples: - exploit * - exploit os_commanding - exploit os_commanding 5

item.name: interact
item.head: List and interact with shell objects generated by exploit plugins.
item.body: Syntax: interact [shell-id] Examples: The "interact" command will list available shells and "interact 3" will start the interaction with the shell with id 3.

item.name: view
item.head: List the available options and their values.

item.name: list
item.head: List the items in the knowledge base.
item.body: Syntax: list TYPE where TYPE is one of: vulns, info, shells

item.name: add
item.head: Add a vulnerability to the KB
item.body:
Syntax: add TYPE Manually adding vulnerabilities to the KB is used by advanced users to give attack plugins the required information about vulnerabilities they want to exploit.
To get a list of the potential TYPEs to add, just press <TAB> twice after typing add.

item.name: list
item.head: List exceptions found during the previous scan.
item.body: Syntax: list [TYPE] where TYPE is one of w3af's plugin types. If no type is specified all exceptions are listed.

item.name: details
item.head: Show the full details for an exception identified by ID
item.body: Syntax: details ID where ID is the ID for the exception you want to analyze as returned by the list command.

item.name: summary
item.head: Show a summary of the exceptions that were caught during this scan.
item.body: Syntax: summary No parameters are required for this command.

item.name: report
item.head: Report an exception to our ticketing server.
item.body: Syntax: report [id[,id..]] If one or more ids are specified in a comma separated list, only those are sent to the ticketing server, else all the exceptions are sent.
